title: Google\Cloud\Redis\V1\Instance
name: Instance
description:
A Google Cloud Redis instance.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Required. Unique name of the resource in this scope including project and location using the form: projects/{project_id}/locations/{location_id}/instances/{instance_id} Note: Redis instances are managed and addressed at regional level so location_id here refers to a GCP region; however, users may choose which specific zone (or collection of zones for cross-zone instances) an instance should be provisioned in. Refer to [location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.location_id] and [alternative_location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.alternative_location_id] fields for more details.

params.name: data.display_name
params.description: An arbitrary and optional user-provided name for the instance.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Resource labels to represent user provided metadata

params.name: data.location_id
params.description: Optional. The zone where the instance will be provisioned. If not provided, the service will choose a zone for the instance. For STANDARD_HA tier, instances will be created across two zones for protection against zonal failures. If [alternative_location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.alternative_location_id] is also provided, it must be different from [location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.location_id].

params.name: data.alternative_location_id
params.description: Optional. Only applicable to STANDARD_HA tier which protects the instance against zonal failures by provisioning it across two zones. If provided, it must be a different zone from the one provided in [location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.location_id].

params.name: data.redis_version
params.description: Optional. The version of Redis software. If not provided, latest supported version will be used. Currently, the supported values are: REDIS_3_2 for Redis 3.2 compatibility REDIS_4_0 for Redis 4.0 compatibility (default) * REDIS_5_0 for Redis 5.0 compatibility

params.name: data.reserved_ip_range
params.description: Optional. The CIDR range of internal addresses that are reserved for this instance. If not provided, the service will choose an unused /29 block, for example, 10.0.0.0/29 or 192.168.0.0/29. Ranges must be unique and non-overlapping with existing subnets in an authorized network.

params.name: data.host
params.description: Output only. Hostname or IP address of the exposed Redis endpoint used by clients to connect to the service.

params.name: data.port
params.description: Output only. The port number of the exposed Redis endpoint.

params.name: data.current_location_id
params.description: Output only. The current zone where the Redis endpoint is placed. For Basic Tier instances, this will always be the same as the [location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.location_id] provided by the user at creation time. For Standard Tier instances, this can be either [location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.location_id] or [alternative_location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.alternative_location_id] and can change after a failover event.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The time the instance was created.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. The current state of this instance.

params.name: data.status_message
params.description: Output only. Additional information about the current status of this instance, if available.

params.name: data.redis_configs
params.description: Optional. Redis configuration parameters, according to http://redis.io/topics/config. Currently, the only supported parameters are: Redis version 3.2 and newer: maxmemory-policy notify-keyspace-events Redis version 4.0 and newer: activedefrag lfu-decay-time lfu-log-factor maxmemory-gb Redis version 5.0 and newer: stream-node-max-bytes stream-node-max-entries

params.name: data.tier
params.description: Required. The service tier of the instance.

params.name: data.memory_size_gb
params.description: Required. Redis memory size in GiB.

params.name: data.authorized_network
params.description: Optional. The full name of the Google Compute Engine network to which the instance is connected. If left unspecified, the default network will be used.

params.name: data.persistence_iam_identity
params.description: Output only. Cloud IAM identity used by import / export operations to transfer data to/from Cloud Storage. Format is "serviceAccount:". The value may change over time for a given instance so should be checked before each import/export operation.

params.name: data.connect_mode
params.description: Optional. The network connect mode of the Redis instance. If not provided, the connect mode defaults to DIRECT_PEERING.

methods.description:

Refer to [location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.location_id] and [alternative_location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.alternative_location_id] fields for more details.

methods.name: getRedisVersion
methods.description:
Optional. The version of Redis software.

If not provided, latest supported version will be used. Currently, the supported values are:

  • REDIS_3_2 for Redis 3.2 compatibility
  • REDIS_4_0 for Redis 4.0 compatibility (default)
  • REDIS_5_0 for Redis 5.0 compatibility

Generated from protobuf field string redis_version = 7 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.name: getRedisConfigs
methods.description:
Optional. Redis configuration parameters, according to http://redis.io/topics/config. Currently, the only supported parameters are: Redis version 3.2 and newer:

  • maxmemory-policy
  • notify-keyspace-events Redis version 4.0 and newer:
  • activedefrag
  • lfu-decay-time
  • lfu-log-factor
  • maxmemory-gb Redis version 5.0 and newer:
  • stream-node-max-bytes
  • stream-node-max-entries

Generated from protobuf field map<string, string> redis_configs = 16 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

  • lfu-decay-time

  • maxmemory-gb Redis version 5.0 and newer:
  • stream-node-max-bytes
  • stream-node-max-entries

Generated from protobuf field map<string, string> redis_configs = 16 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.name: getPersistenceIamIdentity
methods.description:
Output only. Cloud IAM identity used by import / export operations to transfer data to/from Cloud Storage. Format is "serviceAccount:". The value may change over time for a given instance so should be checked before each import/export operation.

Generated from protobuf field string persistence_iam_identity = 21 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OUTPUT_ONLY];
